texts.value: Sodium- and chloride-dependent glycine transporter (PubMed:1534013, PubMed:16181645). Essential for regulating glycine concentrations at inhibitory glycinergic synapses (By similarity)

reaction.name: glycine(out) + chloride(out) + 2 Na(+)(out) = glycine(in) + chloride(in) + 2 Na(+)(in)

texts.value: Interacts with EXOC1; interaction increases the transporter capacity of SLC6A9 probably by promoting its insertion into the cell membrane (PubMed:16181645). Interacts with EXOC3 and EXOC4 (PubMed:16181645)
Found only in the white matter of the CNS
Found in the gray matter of CNS as well as in macrophages and mast cells in peripheral tissues
Belongs to the sodium:neurotransmitter symporter (SNF) (TC 2.A.22) family. SLC6A9 subfamily

citation.title: Cloning, expression, and localization of a rat brain high-affinity glycine transporter.
Cloning and expression of a glycine transporter reveal colocalization with NMDA receptors.
Two glycine transporter variants with distinct localization in the CNS and peripheral tissues are encoded by a common gene.
The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).
Analysis of a gene encoding two glycine transporter variants reveals alternative promoter usage and a novel gene structure.
The glycine transporter GLYT1 interacts with Sec3, a component of the exocyst complex.

referencePositions: INTERACTION WITH EXOC1; EXCO3 AND EXOC4
